title: Tragic mother who lost two daughters dies in freak accident
text:
Jean Haas, 51, whose two daughters tragically died, was killed after she was hit by an SUV in an alley. (Picture: Fox 6)

A mother who tragically lost two of her daughters died was killed in a freak accident.

Jean Haas, 51, died of her injuries after she was struck by a car as she was lying in an alley on Friday in West Allis, Wisconsin.

Police said she fell in the alley and was knocked unconscious. As she woke up and attempted to stand, an SUV slowly drove down the alley with its headlights on and hit her – killing her just feet from her driveway.

Haas’s death is not the first heartbreaking news her family has endured. In 2015, her three-year-old daughter Faith was killed in a house fire. This summer, her 23-year-old daughter died, although it is unclear what caused her death.

After her daughter Faith died, Fox 6 interviewed Haas, who said: ‘It’s like, not real to me, really. I don’t want to believe it. It’s the worst pain I ever had. I had three miscarriages before her, so she was like, really a blessing, like, a little angel.’

Jean Haas’s three-year-old daughter Faith died in a house fire in 2015. (Picture: Fox 6)

The 53-year-old male driver who allegedly ran over Haas has since been arrested and is expected to be charged with hit-and-run, causing death. He has not been named by authorities.

A neighbor’s surveillance camera captured the gruesome moment Haas was run over. The footage shows the driver continue on without stopping, leaving Haas to die in the alley.

Not only did the driver flee the scene, but he also never even bothered to call 911, police said.

A woman returning home from work discovered Haas and called for help. Haas was reportedly pronounced dead at the scene.

Neighbors say the man who was arrested shares the alley where Haas was killed.

Now, Haas’s family is mourning the death of their third relative in five years. Relatives described Haas as a loving mother, grandmother, and an all-around good person.
description: Jean Haas was found dead in an alley in West Allis, Wisconsin after her two daughters tragically died, one this year and the other in 2015.
